title: Vineyard & Buggy tour in Huacachina / 1 day tour from Lima
description: Some visitors to Lima just stay in the city, but in the know travelers make time for at least one day in the nearby oasis town of Huacachina. This full-day tour from Lima starts with a visit to the Tacama vineyard, the oldest in South America. You'll learn about the wine and pisco-making process from an expert guide, and then enjoy a gourmet lunch at the vineyard restaurant. After lunch, it's a short drive to Huacachina, where you'll explore the sand dunes on a dune buggy ride. You'll stop at the top of the dunes to use sandboards and take in the stunning views. The tour ends with a sunset watching over the oasis.
all_descriptions: Some visitors to Lima just stay in the city, but in the know travelers make time for at least one day in the nearby oasis town of Huacachina. This full-day tour from Lima starts with a visit to the Tacama vineyard, the oldest in South America. You'll learn about the wine and pisco-making process from an expert guide, and then enjoy a gourmet lunch at the vineyard restaurant. After lunch, it's a short drive to Huacachina, where you'll explore the sand dunes on a dune buggy ride. You'll stop at the top of the dunes to use sandboards and take in the stunning views. The tour ends with a sunset watching over the oasis.

ItineraryThis is a typical itinerary for this productStop At:Huacachina, Huacachina, Ica RegionHuacachina is an oasis located in the desert of Ica, 4 hours south from Lima. It is known for its beaty, huge dunes and incredible sunsets. One of the must do things in Huacachina is taking a dunebuggy tour which many people describe as a roller coaster. Taking this activity is very worth it and it will also allow you to practice ski or sandboarding.Duration: 3 hoursStop At:Tacama, Av. Camino Real 390, Ica 11000 PeruTamaca is located in the valley of Ica, very close to Huacachina. It started working in 1546 and it's the oldest vineyard in southamerica. Now a days Tacama has became in one of the biggest producers of wine and a Peruvian brandy called Pisco.Duration: 3 hoursPass By:Ica, Ica, Ica RegionIca is the city where we will visit the vineyards and Huacachina to do the dunebuggy tour. Ica is known as the agricultural miracle due to it is quite crazy that in a desert can be grown different kinds of fruit trees.

reviews.title: Would 100% recommend.
reviews.text: It was an extraordinary experience, which also felt very safe. Our driver, Carlos was very friendly and responsible making the experience easy and smooth. We started with the Tacama vineyard where we tasted wine and pisco, had the tour to the wine making processes, great lunch and also watched a horse show. Afterwards we took the car to the oasis and did the Sandhills and Sand-boarding experience. It was really awesome. I would definitely recommend this service.

reviews.title: Fun buggy tour
reviews.text: The Buggy tour was fun and the staff were friendly. I would not book with Travel Adventures Peru (TAP) anymore. We did not an itinerary and they would not return any phone calls or texts when we asked questions. We were picked up by random Peruvians who could not communicate with us in English (after TAP said that they would have someone who could speak English) so we just had to trust that they were taking us where we were supposed to go. We didn't know how long anything was going to take, how long he drive would be. Our driver was falling asleep on the way and we felt so uncomfortable that we said we needed a restroom break just so that we he could wake up for the rest of the drive. He was nice but we were still nervous and tried to contact TAP but they never answered. I would do the buggy tours again but with I recommend Peru Hop. They were VERY nice organized. Could do without Tacama vineyard, but Nietto was fun.

reviews.title: Excellent experience
reviews.text: We did the tour with Jose, he was a great guide and kept us entertained all the time with the history of the places we visited. We had an incredible time and hope to return to Huacachina with the whole family.

reviews.title: Amazing experience and beautiful area
reviews.text: The tour was very organized, punctual and the guide very kind and friendly. Ica surprised us with a beautiful landscape and places as beautiful as Huacachina that seems to be taken from a movie.

reviews.title: The tour was fantastic
reviews.text: Thanks to this tour I had an excellent day and was able to learn a little more about Peru. The Ica region is a wonderful place that has many attractive places such as Paracas and Huacachina. This time I visited Huacachina and I loved it, I'm sure there will be another opportunity to stay more days in this beautiful city.

reviews.title: A perfect day!
reviews.text: This was one of the most beautiful tourist activities we did during our stay in Peru. Ica was the perfect place to escape the cold of Lima and have fun in the Huacachina desert and of course enjoy wine and pisco in the beautiful Tacama vineyard.

reviews.title: Awesome full day in Tacama and Huacachina
reviews.text: This was an awesome tour which started from Lima. Our guide Jose was great at explaining every interesting fact. Tacama, which is the oldest vineyard in South America, is located 15 minutes from the city center. This vineyard produces some of the best wines of Peru and has a great restaurant which offers tasty Peruvian dishes. In the other hand, Huacachina is where the huge dunes are. We had a lot of fun riding a 4WD dune buggy for 2 hours and using the boards to slide on the sand. We recommend booking this tour.

reviews.title: A great day
reviews.text: A lot of fun and the best way to spend a day in Lima, the driver and tour guide were amazing, excellent trip and lovely views in the desert and vineyards. The food was delicious and Alejandro (the tour guide) gave us a lot of information about the places.

reviews.title: A perfect day trip from Lima
reviews.text: We only had one more day before flying home and wanted to get out of Lima to explore a bit more. This trip let us have an amazing day. We went from Lima to Tacama vineyard, it took around 4 hours to get there but the landscape was beautiful and our tour guide Jose shared a lot of interesting information. Tacama is the oldest vineyard in south America and that is one of the facts that attracted us. We did a tasting tour followed but a delicious lunch. After the vineyard we went to Huacachina which is definitely a must do in Peru. Huacachina is an oasis surrounded by palm trees exactly like in the desert movies. Our tour included a dune buggy tour through Huacachinaâs desert which ended up with a great view of the sunset. The way back to Lima felt pretty fast since we were all tired and felt sleep. We honestly recommend doing this trip and we thanks this company and Jose for making our day.

reviews.title: Lot of fun!
reviews.text: Amazing experience and a lot of fun, we really enjoyed the tour, the sunset and the guides. JosÃ© is an incredibly person, kind and good guide. You learn a lot about history in the vineyards and in Huacachina the ride is very fun, JosÃ© was always taking care of our safety.Hope you can enjoy this experience as us.
